quoteText: A rat knows the way of other rats.
A speaker of truth has no friends.
Only a fool tests the depth of the water with both feet.
Evil knows where evil sleeps.
Not to know is bad; not to wish to know is worse.
A hunter who has only one arrow does not shoot with careless aim.
The ax forgets; the tree remembers.
Smooth seas do not make skillful sailors.
If there is no enemy within, the enemy outside can do us no harm.
Crowning a clown won't make him a king.
The wolf loves the fog.
Advice would always be more acceptable if it didn’t conflict with our plans.
The receiver is as bad as the thief.
You can’t unscramble an egg.
If you plant corn, you get corn.
If our foresight were as good as our hindsight, we would never err.
When a man is going downhill, everybody gives him a kick; when a man is going uphill, everybody gives him a lick.
Mules don't kick according to any rules.
It is not enough for a gardener to love flowers.  He must also hate weeds.
Few enjoy money, because they can't get enough.
Mercy to the criminal may be cruelty to the people.
Greed lessens what is gathered.
Excuses are always mixed with lies.
On the day of victory, no one is tired.
Nobody considers himself as contemptible.
Riches disclose bad qualities that are concealed by poverty.
Who gives not thanks to men gives not thanks to God.
You won’t gain knowledge by drinking ink.
Adversity tries virtue.
An idle person is the devil’s playfellow.
It is good to know the truth, but it is better to speak of palm trees.
Better a thousand enemies outside the tent than one within.
A friend is known when needed.
Advice given in the midst of a crowd is loathsome.
Force against force equals more force.
A poor man has no friends.
A good case is not difficult to state.
God is a good worker, but He loves to be helped.
A drunk man's words are a sober man's thoughts
When the student is ready, the master will appear.
We learn to walk by stumbling.
Too much talk will include errors.
A man with too much ambition cannot sleep in peace.
A bird does not sing because it has an answer. It sings because it has a song.
The rich man expends money; the poor man, strength
One's good deeds are known only at home, one's bad deeds far away.
He is a good fellow who can endure wrong.
To say you have done good is not goodness; but to do good is.
The evidence of others is not comparable to personal experience; nor is "I heard" so good as "I saw."
If thine enemy offend thee, give his child a drum.
A dog in a kennel barks at his fleas; a dog hunting does not notice them.
Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day. Teach man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime.
He that is afraid to shake the dice will never throw a six.
The best cure for drunkenness is while sober to see a drunken man.
A day of sorrow is longer than a month of joy.
A word too little is better than a word too much.
Flurried men lack wisdom.
You can chop a man’s head off, but you still can’t keep him quiet.
Everyone pushes a falling fence.
Slander cannot destroy an honest man . . . when the flood recedes the rock is there.
He who shows a passion tells his enemy where he may hit him.
He who neglects a good opportunity, must not afterwards complain.
The fastest horse cannot catch a word spoken in anger.
He who asks is a fool for five minutes, but he who does not ask remains a fool forever.
In the midst of great joy do not promise anyone anything.  In the midst of great anger do not answer anyone’s letter.
To know the road ahead, ask those coming back.
One moment of patience may ward off a great disaster; one moment of impatience may ruin a whole life.
You had better return home and make a net then go down to the river in desire to get fishes.
What you have to do, do without delay.
A thing cannot be at the same time both true and false.
He who sacrifices his conscience to ambition burns a picture to obtain the ashes.
Let the dead care for the dead, and the living for the living.
Gambling is the source of robbery.
The sorrows of the rich are not real sorrows; the comforts of the poor are not real comforts.
To be uncertain is uncomfortable, but to be certain is to be ridiculous.
The twisted tree lives its life, while the straight tree ends up in planks.
It is easier to know how to do a thing than to do it.
The only thing that was missing at the rich man's funeral was mourners.
Who is the greatest liar?  Who talks most of himself.
When men come face-to-face, their differences vanish.
The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is today.
What the ear hears is not like what the eye sees.
Let those who desire to break off drinking habits, when sober, observe a drunken man.
When the prince wants a minister to die, he dies.
How can a tiger ever receive an insult from a dog?
The artful are loquacious, the simple are silent; the artful are miserable, the simple are happy.
Even a mole may instruct a philosopher in the art of digging.
Wealth infatuates as well as beauty.
The wound of a sharp knife will close up, but the hate provoked by evil words will never die.
Misfortune is not that which can be avoided, but that which cannot.
If you believe in gambling, you will have to sell your house.
If you lose your temper, it is a sign that you have wrong on your side.
Money hides many offenses.
The upright fear no thunderbolts.
Sow much, reap much; sow little, reap little.
Walking ten thousand roads is better than reading ten thousand scrolls.
The man who removes a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
A man who cannot tolerate small ills can never accomplish great things.
Talk does not cook rice.
He who deliberates fully before taking a step will spend his entire life on one leg.
What is told in the ear of a man is often heard one hundred miles away.
Great profits, great risks.
Men in the game are blind to what men looking on see clearly.
One dog barks at something, and a hundred bark at his sound.
It is easier to know how to do than it is to do.
Those who have free seat at a play hiss first.
He who makes constant complaint gets little compassion.
Better go to heaven in rags, then to hell in embroidery.
Truth is not determined by the volume of the voice.
Behind every able man there are always other able men.
A man without a smiling face must not open a shop.
Cheap things are not good, good things are not cheap.
A gem cannot be polished without friction, nor man perfected without trials.
Everything you eat affects you profoundly.
The man who comes with a tale about others has himself an ax to grind.
A single bracelet does not jingle.
He who wants to beat the dog will always find a stick.
When a man is not liked, whatever he doth is amiss.
Money is more eloquent than a dozen members of parliament.
A truth teller finds the doors closed against him.
Diligent working makes an expert workman.
He who wants to tell the truth will always stand before closed doors.
One who is willing to help does not wait till he is asked.
Advice after injury is like medicine after death.
He who would serve everybody gets thanks from nobody.
Better no law, than law not enforced.
Envy does not enter an empty house.
A silent man's words are not brought into court.
He is not yet born who can please everybody.
Better to ask twice than to lose your way once.
Better a friend’s bite than an enemy’s caress.
He who builds according to every man’s advice will have a crooked house.
He knows the water best who has waded through it.
What you cannot say briefly you do not know.
He who is afraid of asking is ashamed of learning.
Better cross an angry man than a fasting man.
Many have too much, but none enough.
Kind words don’t wear out the tongue.
Better no law than law not enforced.
He that wants to hang a dog says it bites.
It is better to suffer for truth than to prosper by falsehood.
Hope and expectation are a fool's income.
Many a one would like to lay his own shame on another's back.
Blame is the lazy man's wages.
An evil eye can see no good.
An honest man is none the worse because a dog barks at him.
He kills a man that saves not his life when he can.
He who is fed by another's hand seldom gets enough.
It is poor comfort for one who has broken his leg that another has broken his neck.
He that dare not venture must not complain of ill luck.
A good helper does not wait until he is asked.
Bad is never good until worse happens.
Justice oft leans on the side where the purse hangs.
Care, and not fine stables, makes a good horse.
God help the sheep when the wolf is judge.
Fresh air keeps the doctor poor.
Young pigs grunt as old pigs grunted before them.
Give an ass oats, and it runs after thistles.
Painted flowers have no scent.
In the land of promise, a man may die of hunger.
There are more thieves than are hanged.
Much talk, little work.
No greater promisers than those who have nothing to give.
The wicked shun the light as the devil shuns the cross.
Show me a liar and I'll show you a thief.
The world likes to be deceived.
It is hard to catch hares with unwilling hounds.
Covetousness is never satisfied until its mouth is filled with dirt.
Poverty is the reward of idleness.
He that will have fire must bear with smoke.
A guilty conscience needs no accuser.
Promises makes debts and debts make promises.
Better keep peace than make peace.
It is easy to be generous out of another man's purse.
When two quarrel both are to blame.
He howls with the wolves, and bleats with the sheep.
Ill matched horses draw badly.
"The grapes are sour," said the fox, when he could not get at them.
All are not saints that go to church.
From little things men go on to great.
Many have the Bible on their lips but not in their hearts.
God does not pay weekly, but he pays at the end.
